adjective.description: Having hoofs which are not cloven; having the toes of each foot joined together (as by being webbed). Now historical and rare.
Treading with the whole foot on the ground, not lightly or on tiptoe; heavy-footed. Now rare.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in John Trevisa (c1342–?1402), translator. From whole + foot + -ed.
